thing-type.label: SM810 Door/Window Detector
thing-type.description: Door/Window Detector<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtThe Door/Window Detector is a Z-Wave Plus enabled device and is fully compatible with any Z-Wave enabled network. The device can be set up in a Z-wave network to communicate directly with other end devices such as lighting controllers, or to report directly to a Z-wave controller (usually a gateway).</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtAuto Inclusion -The power is applied for the first time and no node ID has been stored in the module, or after executing reset.</p&gt <p&gtManual Inclusion</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtPut the Z-Wave Controller into inclusion mode.</li&gt <li&gtPress the tamper switch 3 times within 1.5 seconds to put the unit into inclusion mode. </li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<ol&gt<li&gtPut the Z - Wave Controller into exclusion mode. </li&gt <li&gtPress the tamper switch 3 times within 1.5 Seconds to put the unit into exclusion mode. </li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtWakeup Information</h2&gt<p&gtAfter it has been included into a Z-wave network, the detector will go to sleep but send a Wakeup Notifiication Command periodically at preset period to the controller. The detector will stay awake for 10 seconds at least and then go back to sleep to conserve battery life.</p&gt <p&gtThe time internal between Wakeup Notification Commands can be set in the Wakeup Command Class based on the range values below:</p&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gtMinimum Wake Up Interval</td&gt <td&gt <p&gt600s (10 minutes)</p&gt </td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtMaximum Wake Up Interval</td&gt <td&gt86400s (1 day)</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtDefault Wake Up Interval</td&gt <td&gt14400s (4 hours)</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtWake Up Interval Step Seconds</td&gt <td&gt600s (10 minutes)</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt

parameter.name: group_1
parameter.label: 1: Lifeline
parameter.description: Notification Report, Device Reset Locally Notification<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtGroup 1 commands:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtWhen the unit is powered up and was already a part of a Z-Wave network, the unit will send a Notification Report to the node of Group 1.</li&gt <li&gtWhen the tamper switch is released, the unit will send ALARM REPORT command to the nodes of Group 1.</li&gt <li&gtUpon detector status being changed, the unit will check its battery status simultaneously. When the battery level of the unit drops to an unacceptable level, the unit will emit Battery report to the nodes of Group 1.</li&gt <li&gtWhen performing Factory Reset the unit will send Device Reset Locally Notification to the node of Group 1.</li&gt </ul&gt

parameter.name: group_2
parameter.label: 2: Basic Set
parameter.description: Basic Set<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtGroup 2 Commands:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtWhen the door/window is opened, the unit will send BASIC_SET command which contains a value to the nodes of Group 2.</li&gt <li&gtWhen the door/window is closed, the BASIC_SET command will also be sent to the nodes of Group 2.</li&gt </ul&gt
